_header: When folk are feasted and fed fain would they hear
Note: Cf. 6842; also a prose version in Lincoln, Lincoln Cathedral Library 91 [Robert Thornton MS], ff. 1-49.
Title(s): The Wars of Alexander the Great
Bibliographic Ghosts: Present location unknown, James Fairhurst olim sold Keen, 1948: see 5495
_description: The Romance of The Wars of Alexander the Great — about 5800 lines in irregular alliterative lines

BodAsh44.First Lines:
WHen folk er festid and fed fayn wald þai hereSum farand
                    þing efter fode to fayn þare her[t]…
BodAsh44.Last Lines:
…Tiree & Tasse & Tessale oure tributars erePoliponens
                    & Pentapol & Palestyne þe riche
